=== Edubuntu ===
My connection to  is through the <nowiki>[[DCTeam|Washington, DC]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[LoCoTeams|LoCo]]</nowiki>.  I am also one of the core members of the "Computers for Social Justice" project, which is still in the planning phase.  This project is part of a growing effort world-wide to refurbish and reuse old computers in the community.  Our target distribution falls somewhere between Edubuntu and <nowiki>[[#11|Ubuntu Lite]]</nowiki>^11^, as we hope to distribute these older computers in the K-12 school system in northeast DC first.   (We've decided not to establish a web site until we're a bit further along.) I've also written some <nowiki>[[#12|tutorials]]</nowiki>^12^ (primarily for students, staff and faculty at Gallaudet) and am the creator and sporadic maintainer of the <nowiki>[[#3|LEG-UP CD]]</nowiki>^3^.  The CD has been superceded by <nowiki>[[#13|Open CD Project]]</nowiki>^13^.

Speaking of Gallaudet... There is an issue of addressing SpecialNeeds in Edubuntu.
